Directives: text-field

text-field

text-field(attribute, autofocus, debounce, disable, help, focused, blurred, iconAfter, iconAfterClicked, iconBefore, iconBeforeClicked, label, multiline, placeholder, rows, tabIndex, type, uid)

Displays an HTML <input> or <textarea> element along with an optional label. The HTML <input> type can be configured to allow for passwords, numbers, etc. This directive can also be configured to display an informational tooltip. In the event of a validation error, this directive will also render an inline error message.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
attribute String

Name of the attribute within the parent form-for directive's model object. This attributes specifies the data-binding target for the input. Dot notation (ex "address.street") is supported.
autofocus attribute

The presence of this attribute will auto-focus the input field.
debounce int

Debounce duration (in ms) before input text is applied to model and evaluated. To disable debounce (update only on blur) specify a value of false. This value's default is determined by FormForConfiguration.
disable Boolean

Disable input element. (Note the name is disable and not disabled to avoid collisions with the HTML5 disabled attribute).
help String

Optional help tooltip to display on hover. By default this makes use of the Angular Bootstrap tooltip directive and the Font Awesome icon set.
focused function

Optional function to be invoked on text input focus.
blurred function

Optional function to be invoked on text input blur.
iconAfter String

Optional CSS class to display as an icon after the input field. An object with the following keys may also be provided: pristine, valid, invalid In this case the icon specified by a particular state will be shown based on the field's validation status.
iconAfterClicked function

Optional function to be invoked when the after-icon is clicked.
iconBefore String

Optional CSS class to display as a icon before the input field. An object with the following keys may also be provided: pristine, valid, invalid In this case the icon specified by a particular state will be shown based on the field's validation status.
iconBeforeClicked function

Optional function to be invoked when the before-icon is clicked.
label String

Optional field label displayed before the input. (Although not required, it is strongly suggested that you specify a value for this attribute.) HTML is allowed for this attribute.
multiline attribute

The presence of this attribute enables multi-line input.
placeholder String

Optional placeholder text to display if input is empty.
rows int

Optional number of rows for a multline <textarea>; defaults to 3.
tabIndex int

Optional custom tab index for input; by default this is 0 (tab order chosen by the browser)
type String

Optional HTML input-type (ex. text, password, etc.). Defaults to "text".
uid String

Optional ID to assign to the inner element; A unique ID will be auto-generated if no value is provided.
Source:
  • directives/text-field.js, line 1
Example
// To create a password input you might use the following markup:
<text-field attribute="password" label="Password" type="password"></text-field>

// To create a more advanced input field, with placeholder text and help tooltip you might use the following markup:
<text-field attribute="username" label="Username"
            placeholder="Example brianvaughn"
            help="Your username will be visible to others!"></text-field>

// To render a multiline text input (or <textarea>):
<text-field attribute="description" label="Description" multiline></text-field>

// To render icons based on the status of the field (pristin, invalid, valid) pass an object:
<text-field attribute="username" label="Username"
            icon-after="{pristine: 'fa fa-user', invalid: 'fa fa-times', valid: 'fa fa-check'}">
</text-field>
